channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: @TaylorLorenz @erinbiba Fantastic article. Thanks for the link.
Get Ready for the Forever Plague. https://t.co/Myc2T7n7wx
Fireworks are..
Looking for a good show to binge? Here are my recommendations. https://t.co/ahAP2rJHG8
Black Lives Matter. https://t.co/yr9ERwM87t
Have you served on a jury?
@daverpvb thank you! i replied. ;-)

This is only the second time I've heard the Star Spangled Banner done in a non-atrocious way. It's an awful song, but Huey Lewis makes it sound great. The other time was James Taylor at a Boston Red Sox world series game. https://t.co/cqIvebcuT9

1/4 There was a time when all the rivers in NY were polluted. When every apartment building had a furnace where they burned all the garbage.
2/4 I remember walking to school in second grade, scrubbed clean by my mother, with soot falling in my hair on my clothes.
3/4 But then we decided this was no way to live, and we cleaned up our act. We stopped dumping waste into the rivers and air.
4/4 The point is when we decide to fix something we can.
The Who: I'm Free. https://t.co/l0o4M8gxDJ

Fresh Air celebrates July 4 with soul singer Al Green. https://t.co/D5U1CLIg0j
Note that Mitt Romney didn't say anything about guns in his July 4 ode to America.
Veterans worry about the erosion of their constitutional rights. https://t.co/ObcpTQcHo5

A great scene from No Country for Old Men, a movie with a lot of great scenes. The woman says "The coin don't got no say in it." The man says "I got here the same way the coin did." https://t.co/E6uJsVp0BE
Choose to not be offended, at least once a day.
Mitt Romney: America Is In Denial. (I strongly disagree with some of the issues he raises, but the overall conclusion is correct. Without leadership, there's no way out.) https://t.co/ZDdiEIT4YN
Patti Smith reads the Declaration of Independence. https://t.co/xmCRVZGdBd

@donpark You didnâ€™t like the mock-up? https://t.co/JvcFwS4tQg
2007: TV news of the future? https://t.co/Y2KwwbFyUf
2007: Checkbox News. https://t.co/M34r1Udkfg
@donpark Iâ€™ve written about thisâ€¦ https://t.co/M34r1Udkfg

Itâ€™s time for Democrats to fear their own voters. #mustread #amen https://t.co/tpcalm51EU
I've been saying this a different way.
We as citizens have been protesting.
That's wrong. We must be demanding.
Look where protesting got us.
Our politicians, both parties, have forgotten they are responsible to us.
Or more appropriately, we have forgotten.
It's like going to the doctor, and they say okay we have to switch strategies from preventing to mitigating.
In other words you now have the disease we've been trying to prevent.
In Ohio they have a law that makes abortion illegal, now. Not in the future. Today. July 4, 2022.
In other words, we have the disease.
We waited too long.
We didn't listen to the doctor.
I look at what's happening in Ukraine, the Russians destroying cities just for the hell of it.
How far are we from having that happen everywhere?
How far from having it happen here?
But wait, it's even worse than that.
They are preventing Ukraine's wheat from reaching the world. We will see the results of that soon.
So it's not just Ukraine that they're destroying.
Now come on connect the dots.
Trump is Russia. The Repubs are Russia.
Here's the nightmare. The police are Russia too.
We're funding our enemy right now. Arming them. Giving them everything they ask for.
The nightmare is that an awful lot of our military thinks Trump was just right.
And we protest.
Protest is pointless unless it leads to something.
